review: I already have an Apple TV but some months ago I bought a video projector in order to have my own home theater; the thing is that with the Apple TV there are too many cables hanging from the video projector and as I have it in my living room each time I use it I have to connect and disconnect them. With the Google Chromecast this is simple: I connect it to the HDMI and USB connector on the back of the video projector and forget about cables running everywhere. A thing to keep in mind is that Google Chromecast works differently than the Apple TV (or Roku); in the latter one you have a full GUI menu embedded within the Apple TV to browse the different media providers. In Chromecast you have to use a mobile device (Tablet, Smartphone, Laptop) to select the media from a provider like Netflix and then this is casted to the Google Chromecast.
